title: Privacy Policy | Optonet

PRIVACY POLICY

Optonet Ltd, in application of the regulations in force regarding the protection of personal data, informs that the personal data collected through the forms on the Website: https://optonet.online/, are included in the specific automated files of users of Optonet Ltd.

The purpose of the collection and automated processing of personal data is to maintain the commercial relationship and to carry out the commercial relationship and the performance of tasks of information, training, advice and other activities of Optonet Ltd.

These data will only be transferred to those entities that are necessary for the sole purpose of complying with the above mentioned purpose.

Optonet Ltd takes the necessary measures to ensure the security, integrity and confidentiality of the data in accordance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of personal data.

The user may at any time exercise the rights of access, opposition, rectification, cancellation, limitation and portability recognized in the aforementioned Regulation (EU). The exercise of these rights can be carried out by the user himself by email to: optonet@optonetproject.com or at the following address: 28 Virginia Gardens, C.P. WA5 8WN – Warrington (United Kingdom).

The user declares that all the data provided by him/her are true and correct, and undertakes to keep them updated, communicating any changes to updated, communicating any changes to Optonet Ltd.

Purpose of the processing of personal data:

For what purpose will we process your personal data?

At Optonet Ltd, we will process your personal data collected through the Website: https://optonet.online/, with the following purposes:

  1. To comply with the company’s commercial, labor, corporate and accounting obligations.
  2. To provide its services in accordance with the particular needs of the clients, in order to comply with the contracts subscribed by the company.
  3. Comply with the company’s internal processes regarding the administration of suppliers and contractors.
  4. Send promotional information electronically.
  5. Provide the information requested by the user through the contact form.

We remind you that you can oppose the sending of commercial communications by any means and at any time, by sending an e-mail to the address at any time by sending an e-mail to the address indicated above.

The fields in these records must be filled in, and it is impossible to carry out the purposes expressed if these fields are not provided.

How long will the personal data collected be kept?

The personal data provided will be kept for as long as the commercial relationship is maintained or you do not request their deletion and for the period of time for which legal responsibilities may arise from the services provided.

Legitimation:

The processing of your data is carried out with the following legal bases that legitimize the same:

  1. The request for information and/or the contracting of the services of Optonet Ltd. conditions will be made available to you in any case, prior to any eventual contracting.
  2. The free, specific, informed and unequivocal consent, insofar as we inform you by making available to you this privacy policy, which will be made available to you prior to any eventual contracting.

It will be totally impossible to provide you with the requested information or to carry out the contracting of the services.

Recipients:

The data will not be communicated to any third party outside Optonet Ltd, unless legally obliged to do so.

Data collected by users of the services

Optonet Ltd informs that, as a data hosting service provider and in accordance with the provisions of Law 34/2002 of July 11, 2002 on Data Services (LSSI), Optonet Ltd is not responsible for any failure by the user to comply with the RGPD.

Data Retention in accordance with the LSSI

Optonet Ltd informs that, as a provider of data hosting services and in accordance with the provisions of Law 34/2002 of July 11, 2002 on Information Society Services and Electronic Commerce (LSSI), Optonet Ltd. 34/2002 of July 11,, retains for a maximum period of 12 months the information necessary to identify the origin of the hosted data and the time at which the service was provided.

The retention of this data does not affect the secrecy of communications and may only be used in the context of a criminal investigation or for the safeguarding of public security, and will be made available to judges and/or courts or to the Ministry that so requires.
